result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashton C Hoffhein

records.addlTxt:
10:13 AM Defendant Ashton C Hoffhein in court.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant indicated they are applying for a Court Appointed Attorney, requested adjournment. No objection by State.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.

2:23 PM Defendant Ashton C Hoffhein in court.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has applied for SPD but was denied.  Defendant given information regarding court appointed attorney and private counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ashton C Hoffhein
Current: 1906 Vondron Rd, Madison, WI 53716 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 16 OBrien Ct, Madison, WI 53714
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

10:55 AM Defendant appeared.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
